alert.note: Alert for Grayson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Grayson County through 630 PM EDT... At 538 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Comers Rock, or 7 miles northwest of Independence, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 30 mph. Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Very heavy rainfall could result in localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Independence... Fries... Mouth Of Wilson... Sugar Grove... Troutdale... Volney... and Bridle Creek. Radar estimates that between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen just east of Troutdale...along Middle Fox Creek, and Panther Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Excessive rainfall from this storm may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Also watch for debris which may get washed onto the highway, in addition to washed out driveways and culvert pipes.
